attributes.action: Sainsburys Supermarket are refusing to install defibrillators
attributes.background: Sainsburys Supermarkets are refusing to have in store defibrillators stating that their staff are CPR trained. As a retired paramedic I find this hard to understand in this day and age. To the Chairman, please reconsider your decision as this really could save someone's life!!!

rejection.details:
You could write to Sainsbury's to raise this issue directly.

Alternatively, if you wanted Parliament to legislate to require retail businesses to install defibrillators, you could start a petition about that.
